column4: Hello. I am triple booting with windows 7, Mac osx and Ubuntu 10.04. I had a custom grub for my startup that worked fine. Today I ran updates in ubuntu and there was a new kernel, but it didn't show up in my grub when I restarted. I tried to run 'update-grub' after removing my 40_custom grub entry, but when I restarted my grub menu dissapeared. I am just in text mode now. Can anyone help? I backed up my 40_custom to my desktop before doing this.
try: sudo apt-get install os-prober; sudo os-prober; sudo update-grub
expensive system dude
thanks
better?
naw. I got unknown command 'sudo'.
I'm in a grub text menu
sudo os-prober; sudo update-grub    should do it
naw. I got unknown command 'sudo'.
sudo is part of a stock install of Ubuntu
the machine boots up and just shows "GNU GRUB version 1.98-1ubuntu8"
the prompt says "grub>"
if i type "sudo os-prober" i get "unknown command 'sudo'."
what is the output of: lsb_release -c    ?
unknown command 'lsb_release'.
then you arent running linux, which is what Ubuntu is a distribution of
wait are you in linux or the grub prompt?
kinda handy if you'd said so
http://www.ubuntu-inside.me/2009/06/howto-recover-grub2-after-windows.html
'text mode' can be just cli and booted, doesnt explicitly mean a grub prompt
the machine boots up and just shows "GNU GRUB version 1.98-1ubuntu8"... the prompt says "grub>"
the link will help show you how to reinstall the loader from livecd
yeah, i'm working on it now. thanks
